content.description:
IMAGE 1: SAINT LAWRENCE RIVER VALLEY, QUEBEC, CANADA

IMAGE 2: VALE OF THE WHITE HORSE, OXFORDSHIRE, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: Esri Data Partners

The remotely sensed images show the outcomes of different rural land survey methods.
content.question:
A. Describe the land survey method that resulted in the spatial pattern shown in Image 2.

B. Describe an advantage of the land survey method used in the St. Lawrence River valley.

C. Explain why the type of spatial patterns shown in Image 2 are also commonly found in the eastern region of the United States.

D. Explain how the process of suburbanization may affect patterns of rural land use in the St. Lawrence River valley.

E. Explain ONE reason why satellite imagery is useful for visualizing rural landscapes.

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Explain how maps, images, and landscapes illustrate, or relate to geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
